entries.content: Recognize that 'I don't have time' is often a reflex response, not the true objection or root cause.
When a prospect says they don't have time, ask 'When is a good time to call you back?' to test if time is the actual barrier or just a brush-off.
entries.notes: This question attempts to isolate the time objection.

entries.content: Notice when a prospect pivots from a time objection to asking 'What's it regarding?' This indicates the topic itself might be the underlying issue.
entries.notes: This shift reveals a potentially different root cause.

entries.content: 'If I told you it was about [topic] would a little piece of you die?' Use a provocative question to quickly gauge the prospect's true feeling about the topic and uncover the root cause.
entries.notes: Designed to elicit a strong reaction to reveal underlying disinterest.

entries.content: Use targeted questions to quickly see the prospect's reaction and determine the root cause of resistance, allowing for efficient qualification.

focus_area: Objection Discovery: Clarifying questions, isolation, root cause
